inclusion.criterion: clinically indicated treatment must not be delayed for a research-related reason
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients will still be eligible for enrollment after receiving initial bronchodilator therapy as long as their PEFR remains <50% of predicted and enrollment occurs within 90 minutes of the ER arrival time.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The initial part of the consent process will cover the essential elements of the informed consent in a concise manner to ensure a timely process
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Eligible patients will be randomized using the concealed envelope method to either the intervention arm or the control arm.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The assignment will be blinded to the recording investigator and the treating physician but not to the patient or the nurse or respiratory therapist who is administering the nebulization.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: In order to avoid any delay in administering the treatments, the sets of Aeroneb nebulizer and small volume jet nebulizer will be stored in identical boxes and will be readily available in the ER.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The Peak flow and FEV1 will be measured using Spirometer (micro I). Both values will be obtained through the same exhalation maneuver.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient will be treated and managed according to the asthma ER adult protocol or as directed by the ER physician who is in charge of patient's care
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Acute asthma exacerbations presenting to the emergency room
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Peak expiratory flow rate at presentation <40% of predicted
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Enrolment within 90 minutes of the arrival to the ER
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Clinical evidence to suggest a non-asthmatic cause of bronchospasm as determined by the treating physician
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has asthma diagnosed a year ago and presents with shortness of breath, chest tightening and cough. He didn't respond to the usual corticosteroid inhaler.
